abstract: Ryan Lochte wins 200-meter individual medley at swimming world championships, becoming first man to win the event four consecutive times; Katie Ledecky leads United States team to victory in 4x200-meter freestyle relay.
lead_paragraph: Ryan Lochte, 31, become the first man to win the world championship in 200-meter individual medley four consecutive times, and Katie Ledecky led the U.S. to victory in the 4x200 freestyle relay.

headline.main: Ledecky Gains Relay Gold; Lochte Wins 200 I.M.
headline.print_headline: For Fourth Time, Ledecky Wins Gold; for First Time, Her Teammates Do, Too

snippet: Ryan Lochte, 31, become the first man to win the world championship in 200-meter individual medley four consecutive times, and Katie Ledecky led the U.S. to victory in the 4x200 freestyle relay.
